Comment: That's already a fact. In case you didn't know it: manufacturers are busy with the next holiday season roughly from Jan 2nd. Any kind of interruption in the supply chain pretty much guarantees that deadlines will not be met and that things that should be on the shelves in October will simply not be there. Either because they are still in transit or because they simply were never manufactured because it is pointless ending up with a whole raft of unsold last years inventory. And that's before we get into the tandem act between marketing and manufacturing, that needs to stay in sync or you will be spending a whole bunch of budget for stuff you end up not having.      Messing with this machine will cause retailers to go under: those last weeks of the year are the difference between profitability and loss for quite a few companies.
